Ask HN: Share Your Experience with Patents
text:
Have you patented anything while working in an organisation or your own company?

What was the process like? Please share your insights, pitfalls and things to do/avoid.

(I'm quite new to this area and extremely nervous, but I would like to at least patent one or two designs/technology in my current company. I am already working on one; I will finish building it next week and pitch it. But it's not something so amazing, just something that doesn't exist yet, and it would be cool for some people if it did, I'm hoping. If they accept it, I have no idea how to progress.)

title: ChatGPT-Powered Language Learning Chatbot
text:
Hi all! My name is Alex and I am excited to share the project I have been working on: https://LanguageMate.io

I am aiming to turn LanguageMate into the world’s best language learning chatbot to enable you to have anxiety-free conversations with a chatbot in your target language and

The benefit to you is that you now have the daily opportunity, wherever you are, to practise speaking, writing, reading, and listening in your target language.

And practising your target language frequently is crucial to progress and grow your active vocabulary

It is completely free to make an initial account! That account will allow you to start your first conversations to practise one of the 19 languages on offer

The website currently guides you through different common real-world scenarios so you learn relevant vocabulary. It also provides a hint of progress at this early stage as to not overwhelm new users

I would be interested to hear your feedback as I have been busy recently speaking to other users who have been suggesting great ideas for enhancements!

Technically, I use ChatGPT’s new API to provide the other side of the conversations and some other requests to Davinci and Curie for other areas such as translations, improvements, etc

I have also added some gamification elements so far to the website. I aim to be careful with this to not make it spammy but other language apps, namely Duolingo, have used these elements successfully to encourage users back to keep them progressing

I look forward to hearing your thoughts
